name: Composite resin
description: A tooth-colored filling material made of a mixture of plastic and glass or ceramic particles. Composite resin is commonly used to fill cavities caused by tooth decay, as well as for cosmetic dental bonding to improve the appearance of teeth.

name: Dental cement
description: A type of dental adhesive used to attach restorations such as crowns, bridges, and veneers to teeth. Dental cement is available in several different formulations, including resin-modified glass ionomer, zinc phosphate, and polycarboxylate.

name: Calcium hydroxide
description: A material used in root canal therapy to help stimulate new tissue growth and aid in the healing of the tooth. It works by neutralizing acids in the mouth and promoting the growth of hard tissue.

name: Gutta-percha
description: A rubber-like material that is used to fill the space inside the tooth after the infected or damaged tissue has been removed during root canal therapy. Gutta-percha is biocompatible and easy to work with, making it a popular choice for this application.

name: Amalgam
description: A filling material made of a mixture of metals, including mercury, silver, tin, and copper. Amalgam is known for its durability and resistance to wear and tear, but it is less commonly used today due to concerns about its mercury content.

name: Porcelain
description: A type of dental ceramic that is frequently used to make crowns, bridges, veneers, and other restorations. Porcelain is prized for its natural-looking translucency and ability to mimic the appearance of natural tooth enamel.

name: Zirconia
description: A type of ceramic material that is often used to make crowns and bridges due to its strength and durability. Zirconia restorations are biocompatible and highly resistant to wear and chipping.

name: Gold alloy
description: A type of filling material made of a mixture of gold, copper, and other metals. Gold alloy fillings are highly durable and resistant to corrosion, but they are often more expensive than other types of fillings.

name: Porcelain-fused-to-metal
description: A type of dental restoration that combines the strength and durability of a metal substructure with the natural-looking appearance of porcelain. Porcelain-fused-to-metal restorations are commonly used for crowns and bridges.

name: Titanium
description: A strong, lightweight metal that is used frequently in dental implants due to its biocompatibility and ability to fuse with bone tissue in a process called osseointegration.

name: Invisalign
description: A type of clear plastic aligner system used to straighten teeth. Invisalign aligners are removable, comfortable, and virtually invisible, making them a popular alternative to traditional braces.

name: Acrylic resin
description: A type of plastic used to make dentures. Acrylic resin dentures are lightweight, comfortable, and can be easily adjusted or repaired if necessary.

name: Cerinate
description: A type of ceramic material used to make veneers. Cerinate veneers are highly resistant to staining and discoloration, making them a long-lasting and natural-looking option for improving the appearance of teeth.

name: E.max
description: A type of high-strength dental ceramic material used to make crowns, veneers, and other restorations. E.max restorations are highly durable and can be customized to match the color and shape of a patient's natural teeth.

name: Lithium disilicate
description: A type of dental ceramic material used to make restorations such as crowns and veneers. Lithium disilicate restorations are highly aesthetic, strong, and durable.

name: Dental amalgam alloy
description: A type of filling material made of a mixture of metals, including mercury, silver, tin, copper, and zinc. Dental amalgam is strong, durable, and has been used for many years as a filling material.

name: Resilon
description: A type of synthetic polymer used as a filling material for root canal therapy. Resilon is biocompatible and has a similar texture to gutta-percha, but is more flexible and can better adapt to the shape of the tooth canal.

name: Gold foil
description: A type of filling material made entirely of gold that is used for small cavities or areas of the tooth needing repair. Gold foil is long-lasting and biocompatible, but is less commonly used today.

name: Orthodontic bands
description: Stainless steel or titanium bands that wrap around molars to provide anchor points for braces. Orthodontic bands help to move teeth into the proper position and improve bite alignment.

name: Fluoride varnish
description: A liquid solution of fluoride that is painted onto the teeth to help to prevent tooth decay. Fluoride varnish can be applied in a quick office visit and helps to remineralize teeth and strengthen tooth enamel.

name: Proprietary fluoride
description: A concentrated fluoride solution that is applied by a dental professional to help prevent tooth decay. Proprietary fluoride solutions can be used in-office or prescribed for at-home use.

name: Dicalcium phosphate
description: A mineral compound sometimes used in toothpaste and as a dietary supplement to help strengthen teeth and reduce the risk of tooth decay.

name: Sodium fluoride
description: A common compound used in toothpaste and mouthwash to help prevent tooth decay. Sodium fluoride can also be applied in-office by a dental professional to strengthen teeth.

name: Potassium nitrate
description: A compound sometimes used in toothpaste and as a dietary supplement to help alleviate tooth sensitivity. Potassium nitrate works by desensitizing the nerve cells in the teeth.

name: Fluorapatite
description: A naturally occurring mineral found in tooth enamel that is highly resistant to acid erosion and decay. Fluorapatite can also be synthesized in the laboratory and added to dental materials to help strengthen teeth.

name: Sodium trimetaphosphate
description: A mineral compound sometimes used in toothpaste and as a dietary supplement to help reduce the risk of tooth decay.

name: Magnesium hydroxide
description: A mineral compound sometimes used in toothpaste and mouthwash to help neutralize acid and reduce the risk of tooth decay.

name: Chlorhexidine gluconate
description: A mouthwash or gel containing an antiseptic compound used to reduce the bacteria that causes gum disease and other oral infections.

name: Sodium bicarbonate
description: A compound sometimes used in toothpaste and as a whitening toothpaste ingredient. Sodium bicarbonate helps to neutralize acid and gently polish tooth enamel.

name: Hydrogen peroxide
description: A bleaching agent commonly used in teeth whitening treatments. Hydrogen peroxide helps to break down stains and discoloration in tooth enamel.

name: Carbamide peroxide
description: A type of peroxide commonly used in teeth whitening treatments. Carbamide peroxide breaks down into hydrogen peroxide and urea, which help to whiten teeth and remove stains.

name: Baking soda
description: A mildly abrasive substance sometimes used to remove surface stains from teeth. Baking soda is often used in DIY teeth whitening remedies.

name: Calcium phosphate
description: A mineral compound found in tooth enamel that helps to strengthen teeth and reduce the risk of decay. Calcium phosphate can also be used in dental products to help remineralize teeth.

name: Zinc oxide
description: A material sometimes used in dental products to improve the strength and durability of restorations such as dentures and crowns.

name: Alumina
description: A type of dental ceramic material used to make restorations such as crowns and bridges. Alumina restorations are highly resistant to wear and fracture.

name: Hydroxyapatite
description: A naturally occurring mineral found in tooth enamel and bone tissue. Hydroxyapatite can also be synthesized in the laboratory and used in dental products to help remineralize teeth and improve bone density.

name: Composite veneer
description: A type of dental veneer made from a composite resin material. Composite veneers are less expensive than porcelain veneers and can often be completed in a single office visit.

name: Porcelain jacket crown
description: A type of porcelain crown that covers the entire surface of the tooth to provide additional strength and durability. Porcelain jacket crowns can be customized to match the color and shape of the patient's natural teeth.

name: Resin-modified glass ionomer
description: A type of filling material that combines the strength and durability of traditional dental glass ionomer with the adhesive properties of resin-based composite. Resin-modified glass ionomer fillings are often used in areas of the mouth subject to high stress and wear.

name: Silver diamine fluoride
description: A solution that contains both silver and fluoride that can be applied to the teeth to prevent or arrest tooth decay. Silver diamine fluoride works by both killing the bacteria responsible for decay and remineralizing teeth.

name: Polycarbonate crown
description: A temporary crown made of a clear polycarbonate material. Polycarbonate crowns are often used as an esthetic temporary solution while a permanent crown is being fabricated.

name: Disposable prophylaxis paste
description: A professional dental paste used for smoothing and polishing teeth.

name: Endodontic sealer
description: A substance used in root canal treatment to fill and seal the space inside the tooth.

name: Sutures
description: A thread-like material used to hold tissues together after surgery.

name: Brackets
description: Small metal or ceramic pieces that are attached to teeth to hold wires and elastics in place for orthodontic treatment.

name: Archwire
description: A flexible wire used in orthodontic treatment to move and align teeth.

name: Grafts
description: A surgical procedure where tissue or bone is taken from one part of the body and transplanted to another part.

name: Abutment
description: A piece of hardware used in implant dentistry to connect the dental implant to the prosthetic tooth or bridge.

name: Clear aligners
description: A type of orthodontic treatment that utilizes clear plastic aligners to straighten teeth.

name: Antibacterial mouthwash
description: A liquid solution used to kill bacteria and freshen breath by rinsing the mouth.

name: Surgical dressing
description: A protective bandage or covering applied to a surgical site to promote healing and prevent infection.

name: Sedative
description: A medication used to help patients relax and minimize discomfort during dental procedures.

name: Sealant resin
description: A thin, plastic coating that is applied to the chewing surfaces of back teeth to prevent cavities.

name: Surgical wiring
description: A technique used to stabilize teeth or jaws after surgery or injury.

name: Custom-fitted material
description: A material that is made to fit a specific individual's teeth or oral structure.

name: Adjustable appliance
description: An orthodontic appliance that can be adjusted over time to gradually move teeth into the desired position.
